page.title: 19RIDDLECOMBE AND COTTWOOD
page.content: {Riddlecombe}is a small village in the Parish of{Ashreigney.}It has no shop, Post Office, inn or church. The hamlet of{Cottwood}stands above the Mully Brook. It is between minor roads lead- ing to Riddlecombe and Ashreigney. An unmetalled road provides motor access to Riddlecombe, and a public bridleway to Woodrow Bridge on the Ashreigney road leading to Mully Brook Mill. The {pleasant bridleway}runs through new plantations of conifers with undergrowth of low shrubs, heather and bracken.The plantation is edged by older deciduous trees. One of the {houses}in Cottwood is being extended. The new extension will be{thatched}and the walls will be rendered to match the{cob}walls of the original building. When built the cottages cost Â£12.50
